preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: Welcome to the Underworld Adventures Manual. This manual explains all things that have to do with configuring and running Underworld Adventures. Please note that this is not the manual for Ultima Underworld I or II.

To play the games using Underworld Adventures, you definitely need the original game om floppy discs or on CD-ROM (when using the "Electronic Arts Presents CD-Rom Classics : Ultima Underworld I & II" CD). It would also be good to have the original manuals.

section.title: System Requirements
section.para:
Here is a list of things you should have to fully (or at all) relive the old games in new clothes:
A modern 32-bit processor (600 MHz or above recommended) A modern Operating System (Windows, Linux, etc.) A decent 3D-Graphics card with current OpenGL drivers, e.g. an Nvidia GeForce A Sound card

chapter.title: Running Underworld Adventures
chapter.para: Underworld Adventures is played just like Ultima Underworld I and II. However there are some minor things that are not in the old games.

section.title: Load/Save screen
section.para: One limitation of the Underworld games were the number of savegames one can use during the game. Underworld Adventures lifts that limitation by providing practically unlimited number of savegames. Another way had to be found in Underworld Adventures to access and handle those.

Underworld Adventures introduces the savegame Load/Save screen that is used to either load a savegame, e.g. when using "Journey Onward" on the game's screen, or when selecting "Save Game" or "Restore Game" in the game's builtin menu. The old way of accessing the savegames via buttons numbered I to IV and savegame descriptions listed in the text scroll are gone now.

section.title: Quicksave Feature
section.para: The current game can quickly be saved using the Quicksave feature. The key F11 saves the current game to a special Quicksave slot. With F12 one can restore the previously saved quicksave savegame. If you have modified the key bindings, look up the keys used for quickloading and quicksaving in the modified keymap.cfg.

section.title: Differences to the original game
section.para: While creating Underworld Adventures there were some things that were done differently than in the original games. Reasons for this are mainly to simplify the game, to improve it in some way, or just to implement things in another way that else would have been too difficult or hard to do.

Here is the list of things that are different than in Ultima Underworld 1. Some of the options can be switched off with the "enable-uwadv-features" setting in the configure file. See Section x for that.
Up/down view angle can be varied between -75 and 75 degree, as opposed to something like 45 degrees in the original (can be switched off).
Cutscene speech is played a bit too slow (due to some technical reasons the audio samples isn't exactly converted to the proper frequency).
The input cursor in text scrolls (e.g. in conversations) is a vertical line, and not a blinking cursor square. The cursor can be moved to any position in the input field.
